item.title: Large and growing pothole that has existed for years is now very big in January 2026, 13th January
item.description:
This pothole has been here for several months having previously received a temporary repair. I have witnessed cars experiencing dangerous challenges when turning left out of the Sainsbury's onto this road
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bugsbys Way, Charlton

item.title: Flytipping outside entrance to 55 Allendale Close, 13th January
item.description:
The tenant at number 60 Allendale Close has left cardboard, wood and a mattress outside the entrance to the flats. This was dumped on 7th January 2026 and is now soaked through. This needs to be removed as soon as possible, as it is hindering the main exit of the flats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allendale Close, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip just around corner of Sainsbury’s Local, on Sidney Road, 13th January
item.description:
Fly tip of small suitcase and electric cooking device. Please remove. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidney Road, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Beatty Road in really bad shape, 13th January
item.description:
The top of Beatty Road towards the high street has not been swept and cleaned in weeks, it’s just depressing to walk through that with my daughter going to school everyday.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beatty Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog bin never emptied, 13th January
item.description:
Please remove the dog bin. It’s never emptied and is being reported frequently as you don’t empty it so please remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Firbank Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked of parking /broken pavements, 13th January
item.description:
Building works have started on new houses at location 55 little birches. Builders have blocked parking bays and have broken paving slabs, causing danger to pedestrians . Delivery trucks dangerously close to parked cars and causing damage to paving and grassed areas. Builders are not adhering to set restrictions of start and finish times in built up residential area. Noise pollution and damage to our street isn’t unacceptable. Please send an official council employee to assess the situation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Little Birches, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 15 inch deep pothole on the junction of archway road and southWood Lane, 13th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 347, Archway Road, Greater London
